Major inland flooding is the biggest concern due to the slow movement of this storm.

factText: Chris Jansing reports from Gulf Shores, Alabama as Hurricane Sally is set to make landfall. Hurricane Sally will make landfall tomorrow and play a significant role in the Tennessee Valley Valley forecast. Hurricane Warnings are in effect for the Alabama Coast. The Gulf coast has already been feeling the affects from Hurricane Sally for several hours now. As the storm has slowed down, landfall is not expected until Wednesday morning.

As volunteers get set for Hurricane Sally Relief Efforts, more than two dozen help victims of Hurricane Laura on the Gulf Coast. Also, three emergency vehicles head west to provide wildfire relief. Our friend and colleague Brian Gerber is currently in Louisiana not only supporting the Red Cross response for Hurricane Laura but also helping to prepare for Hurricane Sally's landfall later this wee

factText: COMING UP -Hurricane Sally looms off the Gulf Coast, threatening historic flooding -Rescue teams are searching for 22 missing people in Oregon amid major wildfires -A settlement in the Breonna Taylor . factText: Gautier Police Department double shifts during Hurricane Sally. We hope everyone remains safe. Please call if you need any assistance. Due to Hurricane Sally we will be closed Wednesday. We want to keep our customers and employees safe. If you have a service emergency please call Nolen Jackson (334)504-0471.
